speaker: PHIL
line: Bobby!

speaker: PATTI
line: Phil ….

speaker: PHIL
line: I’ve had it with that kid, Patti.

speaker: PATTI
line: I’ve already talked to him.

speaker: PHIL
line: Yeah, like he ever listens.

speaker: PHIL
line: You hear me calling your name? Get up.

speaker: BOBBY
line: What are you doing?

speaker: PHIL
line: You think this is why I wake up and go to work every day -- So you can sit around on your ass?

speaker: BOBBY
line: What did I do?

speaker: PHIL
line: What’d you do? You never do anything, that’s the problem. What kind of a loser are you going to turn out to be? Put your boots on.

speaker: PHIL
line: You don’t leave my tools out in the rain. Tools are for work. They cost money.

speaker: BOBBY
line: Fine, I’ll put it away.

speaker: PHIL
line: After you’re finished. Pick it up. I’m not going to let your mother watch you grow up to be some kind of a jerk.

speaker: BOBBY
line: Fine, I’ll put it away …Phil.

speaker: PHIL
line: No way. You’ll finish the job … Now.

speaker: BOBBY
line: Get away from me! Get away from me now!

speaker: PHIL
line: Bobby! Bobby! Where are you going?! Bobby! Come back here!

speaker: PHIL
line: Come here! Bobby! Bobby! Bobby! Bobby? Bobby?

speaker: PATTI
line: Bobby?! Bobby?!

speaker: SCULLY
line: 12 pounds, 9 ounces.

speaker: MULDER
line: All that came out of his stomach?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Most of it. The small amount in his lungs is what killed him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it possible that he took the term "mud pie" literally?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I’m sure if Mr. Rich were alive he would find some humor in that. According to his police report, Mr. Rich was a man who could tell a joke. He grew up here. Worked the same fields for 20 years. Well liked around town. Funny he should turn up murdered.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that what you’ve concluded?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have concluded is that this man’s head was held forcibly down in the Michigan mud just a little too long. Most likely by his stepson who was named in the report as Bobby Rich. Age 16.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, according to the same report the coroner had to hire a backhoe to remove the body, which was buried completely in a standing vertical position.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There is some indication that his stepson may have dug the hole and that a recent rainstorm may have helped turn it into a muddy trap.

speaker: MULDER
line: That was some rainstorm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They say it rained 400 inches a day.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now that sounds like an exaggeration, don’t you think?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would you like me to show you how he may have done it?

speaker: MULDER
line: How a 6’4" 250-pound man was buried alive in less than five minutes by a 16-year-old kid whose classmates lovingly refer to as "Dork-weed?"

speaker: SCULLY
line: He may have had an accomplice.

speaker: MULDER
line: "Ich bin ein auslander." "I am an outsider." You know, when Kennedy told the Germans "Ich bin ein Berliner" he was actually saying "I am a cocktail sausage."

speaker: BOBBY
line: Who’s Kennedy?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m not … I’m not here to accuse you of anything, Bobby.

speaker: BOBBY
line: What are you here for then?

speaker: MULDER
line: I want to hear your story.

speaker: BOBBY
line: I tried to help. I couldn’t.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, the police aren’t entirely convinced that that’s the truth.

speaker: BOBBY
line: So what the hell am I supposed to do about it? They want me to confess so they have someone to blame.

speaker: MULDER
line: Right. But you see, you’re not making it very easy for them to believe otherwise. You understand that?

speaker: BOBBY
line: What can I say? Everybody knows I hated him.

speaker: PATTI
line: They were real close when Bobby was little. Always kidding around and stuff. But Bobby sort of got into that teenage stage – He don’t want to listen to nobody.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And it came to a head last night?

speaker: PATTI
line: Phil was late coming home. He’d been stressed out ‘cause of the blight and stuff.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: PATTI
line: His nut trees all got a disease. And Bobby don’t help things out with his attitude and stuff.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did Phil instigate what happened?

speaker: PATTI
line: It’s hard to tell what starts these things. Phil could be stern – just like his own father was to him. But I never saw him raise his hand.

speaker: BOBBY
line: When I saw him lying in the mud, I mean, I half expected him to pull me in. Like he had planned it or something.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did he ever hurt you?

speaker: BOBBY
line: Phil? He used to get off shoving me around, yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you ever shove him back?

speaker: BOBBY
line: He’s twice as big as me.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s why some people thought you might have dug the hole. Or attacked him when he fell in the hole because he was down there.

speaker: BOBBY
line: Well, that’s their problem, isn’t it?

speaker: MULDER
line: You remember what was going through your head at the time?

speaker: BOBBY
line: I guess … I felt he had it coming.

speaker: PATTI
line: He was kneeling over Phil – struggling real hard and stuff.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Could you tell that he was definitely trying to help him?

speaker: PATTI
line: It seemed that way to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, there’s a strong chance the police are going to arrest your son for murder.

speaker: PATTI
line: I don’t see how.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But if they do, and if there’s evidence of abuse that you’re not coming forward with, it could hurt his chances.

speaker: PATTI
line: I know everything happens for a reason, but I still don’t see no reason for this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They’re all dying. According to Bobby’s mother, that’s a big reason why her husband blew up. His hazelnut orchard was hit with a blight.

speaker: MULDER
line: So he pounds the kid. And the kid pounds back. Is that what she told you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well not in so many words. Actually, she won’t admit to any abuse in the house. I suspect she’s just trying to move on and protect what family she’s got left.

speaker: MULDER
line: Kid says his stepfather teed off on him regularly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That’s his excuse?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, that’s his explanation. He says he’s innocent.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you think?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think he’s a hard kid to love.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m still finding it hard to reconcile the facts with the physical evidence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, even if he didn’t dig this hole, the disease could have killed root systems creating weakened soil.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then how did the victim swallow 12 pounds of this stuff?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, when you fight for air a vacuum is created. And maybe once he sucked down a mouthful of mud it turned his esophagus into a siphon. With his head pushed down, it filled all of his passages like a gas can.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well … you asked me for answers. Those are the best ones I’ve got.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you ask if anybody else might be involved?

speaker: SCULLY
line: His mother says that Bobby can’t make friends. He’s been in therapy for his anger since 1995.

speaker: MULDER
line: That could be me.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Someone’s watching us. Sir? Hello.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who was it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t know. He’s gone.

speaker: BOBBY
line: Lisa. Hey.

speaker: LISA
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: BOBBY
line: I - I called you last night. I mean, how come you didn’t call me back?

speaker: LISA
line: They’re saying you killed him, Bobby.

speaker: BOBBY
line: I finally stood up to him.

speaker: TEEN 1
line: Hey, Psycho. Think fast.

speaker: BOBBY
line: Just get away from me, okay?

speaker: TEEN 1
line: Or what? What are you going to do, huh?

speaker: BOBBY
line: Maybe I’ll kill you, too, huh?

speaker: TEEN 1
line: Psycho killer.

speaker: BOBBY
line: See… All you got to do is stand up. I’ll see you later, then. )

speaker: MULDER
line: Karin Matthews?

speaker: KARIN
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We’re Agents Mulder and Scully with the FBI.

speaker: KARIN
line: I hope my directions were clear. I’m a little tucked away.

speaker: KARIN
line: I first worked with Bobby after an incident at school. He’s had difficulty developing relationships and this difficulty has caused him to act out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In what way?

speaker: KARIN
line: By putting on certain airs. Affecting an attitude that has drawn the wrong kind of attention to himself. I’ve seen him come in here pretty beaten up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Physical violence?

speaker: KARIN
line: More than just kid stuff.

speaker: MULDER
line: Was his stepfather ever involved?

speaker: KARIN
line: I’m not free to speak with perfect frankness, of course.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If you know that Bobby committed a crime, you’re under legal obligation to tell us.

speaker: KARIN
line: Bobby once spilled a glass of milk at dinner. For the next two weeks, he was forced to eat in the cellar. No table, no chair, no light. Sometimes he was left down there until the following morning. You see, there are all sorts of crimes. Not just the ones you might find reason to investigate.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you’re saying Bobby would have good reason to kill his father.

speaker: KARIN
line: I’m saying there are some crimes where there are only victims.

speaker: MULDER
line: You’re free not to answer, Miss Matthews – or you’re free to make these vague allusions – but your evasiveness is only going to land this kid in jail for a long, long time.

speaker: KARIN
line: I’m not sure I understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: You make it sound like a justification. Like Bobby did it. And I don’t think he did.

speaker: BOBBY
line: Hey. What are you doing?

speaker: LISA
line: Going home.

speaker: BOBBY
line: Well, I waited for you. I thought … I thought we were going to talk. So…

speaker: LISA
line: You scared me today, Bobby.

speaker: BOBBY
line: Why? Was it because I stood up for myself or, um … because I didn’t let them beat me up like usual?

speaker: LISA
line: I got to go.

speaker: BOBBY
line: You got to stand up, Lisa. You got to tell your Dad that you’re not going to put up with his crap. There is a way to make it go away … forever.

speaker: FATHER
line: What the hell business you got with him?

speaker: LISA
line: Nothin’. He’s just a friend.

speaker: FATHER
line: I don’t want you seeing that kid. I don’t want him coming around here. Do you hear me?

speaker: LISA
line: Stop it, okay?

speaker: FATHER
line: I’m doing what’s right for you …

speaker: LISA
line: Just shut up!

speaker: SCULLY
line: The victims name was … Eugene Baiocchi, forties. He was a foreman for one of the local growers. Single parent.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you get a look at the body?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It had already been removed. I think it’s pretty clear what killed him, though. From what they’ve put together, they’ve all but concluded he was pushed out the window.

speaker: MULDER
line: Pushed out?

speaker: SCULLY
line: His daughter Lisa made the 911 call at 8:08 p.m. She says she and her father had a fight.

speaker: MULDER
line: About what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bobby.

speaker: KARIN
line: I don’t want you to worry about anything, all right? Now, I’ll he here for you as much as possible. But they’re going to come and ask you some questions and the most important thing is that you feel comfortable. If you don’t fell comfortable answering them, then I don’t want you to answer them, okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can I have a moment … with Lisa?

speaker: MULDER
line: Was Lisa another of you clients?

speaker: KARIN
line: Lisa?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: KARIN
line: Yes, for four years.

speaker: MULDER
line: What were you treating her for?

speaker: KARIN
line: An eating disorder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you asked her what happened?

speaker: KARIN
line: Isn’t that your job?

speaker: MULDER
line: We gather that she had a fight with her father over Bobby Rich.

speaker: KARIN
line: Well, it doesn’t surprise me. Lisa’s father was very disapproving of her generally which stemmed to a lot of her problems.

speaker: MULDER
line: Had you counseled her father?

speaker: KARIN
line: No. My approach is with the victims solely to allow them to empower themselves.

speaker: MULDER
line: In what ways?

speaker: KARIN
line: By breaking the cycle of abuse. By owning it. By confronting it and by standing up against it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Seems to be working.

speaker: KARIN
line: When I told Lisa her aunt was coming to pick her up tomorrow, she started to cry. It wasn’t out of sorrow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Three guesses who followed Lisa home last night and was sitting out front in his father’s truck just minutes before this happened.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does she think Bobby did it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She thinks he’s quite capable.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think we’re all quite capable.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, she says that he also threatened to kill a boy in school yesterday.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come here. Take a look at this. If Lisa’s father was pushed out, then all the glass would be outside. Look. There’s glass here on the inside. The paint on the mullions is cracked on the outside, not on the inside here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, seems to me like some facts have been assumed. It looks to me like Lisa’s father was pulled out the window, not pushed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How?

speaker: MULDER
line: That I don’t know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there’s nowhere to stand. Even if he did use a ladder there’d be no leverage. I mean, especially for a scrawny 16-year-old kid.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s my point exactly.

speaker: TEACHER
line: …. Na-O-H … and hydrochloric acid. All right, class. There will be a quiz on this tomorrow, so take good notes. Now …

speaker: TEACHER
line: May I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sorry to interrupt. I need to ask you to come with us, please.

speaker: BOBBY
line: What for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: To answer some questions.

speaker: BOBBY
line: About what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t want to have to embarrass you in front of your class.

speaker: BOBBY
line: Well, I ain’t embarrassed.

speaker: CORONER
line: I’m fairly certain that this man died from a broken neck.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but there was a substantial amount of blood loss, wasn’t there?

speaker: CORONER
line: Yes, but the cuts all missed the artery. I have x-rays, if you don’t believe me. It’s the fourth and fifth vertebrae.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you determined if the neck injury was caused by the fall?

speaker: CORONER
line: Well, what else would it have been?

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you seen this? What do you make of this here?

speaker: CORONER
line: Huh.

speaker: BOBBY
line: Are you satisfied?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I’m not.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?

speaker: BOBBY
line: What is that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Evidence.

speaker: BOBBY
line: Of what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You just trying to scare him?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. I think he’s scared enough as it is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Of what?

speaker: KARIN
line: I’ll help getting the rest of your things packed. But I think it’s best that you go to your aunt’s as soon as possible.

speaker: LISA
line: When’d she say she was coming?

speaker: KARIN
line: First thing in the morning. Feel it. It’s okay. Come on.

speaker: DEEP VOICE
line: You never learn!

speaker: KARIN
line: I’m sorry. Please, just don’t yell.

speaker: DEEP VOICE
line: What’ll you ever amount to?

speaker: KARIN
line: No. Stop it. Stop it.

speaker: DEEP VOICE
line: Where are you going?

speaker: KARIN
line: Up to my room.

speaker: DEEP VOICE
line: You’re ruining my life. You hear me? I wish you’d never been born!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you looking for?

speaker: MULDER
line: That splinter you’re holding came from Mr. Baiocchi’s neck but it didn’t come from the broken window.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where did it come from?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s greenwood, fresh from a living tree.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me. It’s been a few years.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What? You think that Bobby climbed this tree to pull Lisa’s father out of that window?

speaker: MULDER
line: Kind of begs the question, doesn’t it? Hey, Scully, is this demonstration of boyish agility turning you on at all?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who are you?

speaker: OLD ORCHARD MAN
line: I take care of the trees.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I didn’t expect you to be standing right there behind me. You were watching us the other day in the orchard.

speaker: OLD ORCHARD MAN
line: The trees are dying.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully …

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe you should come down here, Mulder. You, uh, know what kind of tree this came from?

speaker: OLD ORCHARD MAN
line: Same as this tree.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You, uh … you said these trees were dying. This, this splinter’s live wood.

speaker: OLD ORCHARD MAN
line: 20 years ago this happens.

speaker: MULDER
line: What causes this?

speaker: OLD ORCHARD MAN
line: A very bad man.

speaker: DEEP VOICE
line: She’s just like you – a little snoop! Where is she?

speaker: MULDER
line: Ms. Matthews, we’d like to ask you a few questions.

speaker: KARIN
line: About what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Your father’s death. We need to clarify a few details.

speaker: KARIN
line: My father? He died twenty years ago

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, under rather curious circumstances. His body was pulled from the mud of an orchard?

speaker: KARIN
line: I-I’m sorry, I was just a-a young girl. I don’t know why you want to talk to me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, we thought it was strange that you didn’t bother to mention it.

speaker: KARIN
line: Well, I don’t see that it matters.

speaker: MULDER
line: We spoke to someone who thinks it does. Someone who worked for you father? According to the orchard man, Your father’s death brought about the end of a blight affecting the trees.

speaker: KARIN
line: My father was a powerful man. Powerful men are prone to inspire this kind of fantasy. Don’t tell me you’ve been taken in by it, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is Lisa still staying with you?

speaker: KARIN
line: No, she’s not. She’s gone to her aunt’s. Look, I’m sorry. I can’t help.

speaker: LISA
line: Help me! I’m down here! Help!

speaker: KARIN
line: Lisa …. Lisa.

speaker: LISA
line: Karin … Karin! Karin! Karin.

speaker: KARIN
line: Lisa, you’ve got to be quiet – quiet as a mouse – or he’s going to hear you down there.

speaker: LISA
line: Karin, I’m scared. Let me out, please.

speaker: KARIN
line: I will, but not until it’s safe.

speaker: LISA
line: Karin, Karin, I don’t want to stay down here. Please let me out. Karin …

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, whatever you’re hoping we find here – without a court order, it won’t be admissible.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m not expecting it to be.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder … Where’s the body?

speaker: KARIN
line: Yes?

speaker: AUNT LINDA
line: I’m Linda Baiocchi. Lisa’s aunt. Are you Karin?

speaker: KARIN
line: Yes…

speaker: AUNT LINDA
line: Is Lisa here?

speaker: KARIN
line: No. She went … She’s gone to the bus station.

speaker: AUNT LINDA
line: She has? But it was all arranged…

speaker: KARIN
line: I don’t know what to tell you. I’m sorry. There must have been a misunderstanding.

speaker: LISA
line: I’m down here! Help me! Aunt Linda, I’m down here!

speaker: AUNT LINDA
line: What are you doing down there?

speaker: LISA
line: Just get me out, please?

speaker: AUNT LINDA
line: Okay. It’ll be okay. I’m going to call the police.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you still haven’t answered my question. What happened to Karin’s father? Why would anybody steal his body?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t think this was an act of grave robbing, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. That’s what we were doing.

speaker: MULDER
line: More like an act of nature.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: The orchard man said that the blight that plagues this town was caused by a man – implying a connection.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m a little afraid to ask what kind of connection.

speaker: MULDER
line: Between the people of this valley and their

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bobby’s father, Lisa’s father …

speaker: MULDER
line: And Karin’s father, 20 years ago: all men who worked in these orchards -- their lives and deaths tied to these trees. We removed a sliver of greenwood from Lisa’s father’s neck. And the bruise that you found on Bobby’s father’s ankle could have been caused by a root -- The same root system that pulled Karin’s father from his grave.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, there is a connection between these deaths children …

speaker: MULDER
line: Who couldn’t defend themselves.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What? So nature did it for them?

speaker: MULDER
line: Something did it for them – or someone controlling nature. Karin said she was counseling Bobby and Lisa to empower them. I think we should talk to them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I called Lisa at her aunt’s house 20 minutes ago and there was no answer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then we should talk to Bobby.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, we’ve already questioned him twice.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe we haven’t asked him the right question.

speaker: BOBBY
line: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, you do. Maybe you hated your stepfather, but you didn’t kill him. You don’t have it in you.

speaker: BOBBY
line: That’s good. That’s really good. Can I go now?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. You can’t go until you tell me the truth. For the first time in your life people are taking you seriously and I think they should take you seriously. I think you’re a serious kid. Not an outsider anymore, huh?

speaker: BOBBY
line: Yeah. I’m thinking about running for ASB president. So why don’t you just give it up?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don’t you give it up? Why don’t you tell me what happened that night? You took the shovel to him, but you couldn’t do it, so you ran, you ran to the orchard, but not because you dug a hole or laid a trap --

speaker: (BOBBY FLASHBACK
line: PHIL chasing him through the orchard.)

speaker: MULDER
line: – because you were afraid, not of Phil.

speaker: (BOBBY FLASHBACK
line: PHIL drowning in the mud.)

speaker: MULDER
line: You weren’t afraid of Phil –Phil never hit you or hurt you in that way. In fact, I think you wanted to help Phil.

speaker: (BOBBY FLASHBACK
line: PHIL screaming as he sinks into the mud.)

speaker: MULDER
line: You wanted to save him. You didn’t want Phil to die, did you?

speaker: MULDER
line: What were you afraid of, Bobby?

speaker: BOBBY
line: I couldn’t do it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Couldn’t do what?

speaker: BOBBY
line: I couldn’t stand up to him. But she made me.

speaker: MULDER
line: She who?

speaker: KARIN
line: K-Karin. Karin she-she made me, uh …

speaker: BOBBY
line: You’re a loser! You understand me?! I wish you’d never been born!! You’re ruining my life!!

speaker: MULDER
line: Karin made you what?

speaker: BOBBY
line: She made me say those things. She had me pretend that I was him – that I was - I was Phil.

speaker: MULDER
line: She made you believe you were a victim but you weren’t, were you?

speaker: BOBBY
line: She … said I have … the power to - to make it all go away. But I … I didn’t mean for him to die.

speaker: PATTI
line: It’s okay.

speaker: DEEP VOICE
line: You think you can hide down there? You think you’re safe?

speaker: KARIN/DEEP VOICE
line: You’ll wish you were dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Karin?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully. Take a look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder …

speaker: MULDER
line: Talk about putting down roots.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What the hell is going on here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think we’re looking at Karin Matthews’ father.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But how did he get here?

speaker: MULDER
line: The same way Bobby’s father got pulled down into that mud.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I …

speaker: MULDER
line: This has to do with Karin, with her own father’s abuse. It was never Bobby that was locked in the cellar. Karin was. Karin caused all this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think Karin is the killer?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think she’s the killer and the victim.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lisa … Where’s Karin.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re going to be okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: You stay with her, Scully.

speaker: KARIN
line: I need to see Bobby.

speaker: PATTI
line: I’m sorry. Bobby’s not here.

speaker: KARIN
line: He’s in danger.

speaker: PATTI
line: Get away from here, please.

speaker: KARIN
line: Bobby!

speaker: PATTI
line: He’s not here.

speaker: KARIN
line: Where is he?!

speaker: KARIN
line: Bobby! Bobby! Bobby! Bobby!

speaker: BOBBY
line: Stay away from me! I’m warning you.

speaker: KARIN/DEEP VOICE
line: You’re pathetic.

speaker: KARIN/DEEP VOICE
line: You little piece of garbage.

speaker: MULDER
line: Karin! Stop!

speaker: KARIN/DEEP VOICE
line: You stay away from him!

speaker: MULDER
line: Stand up to him!

speaker: KARIN/DEEP VOICE
line: Karin deserves what she gets.

speaker: MULDER
line: Make him stop, Karin! Tell him what you should have told him 20 years ago. You’re not going to take it anymore.

speaker: KARIN/DEEP VOICE
line: Karin’s dead.

speaker: OLD ORCHARD MAN
line: It’s done now. No more.

speaker: MULDER
line: Coats Grove authorities conducted a detailed examination of the soil and root composition in the Rich family orchard, but could not explain what pulled Karin Matthews’ body into the Michigan mud. Nor could the authorities determine how the body of Karin’s father was pulled from its grave into her root cellar three years earlier. While the forensic data is inconclusive, I believe the explanation lies in hospital records dating back to Karin’s childhood, which suggests that she, herself was a victim of abuse. Rage, unconfronted, takes its own path. I believe it was Karin’s unconfronted rage that forced her to face her buried father. This same rage made her imagine victims in the children around her, trying to instill in them a strength she never found in herself. What happened to Karin Matthews in the orchard that night was a release. Release for a victim, who, unable to face up to her own past was finally consumed by it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Abuse exists, as does the blindness that accompanies it. The pleading cries in the night followed by the disturbing As witness to a horrific event, I am forced to question the frequently blurred line between right and wrong to weigh the guilt of one man’s act against another’s to decide if justice was served or if a grievous injustice has prevailed. And if pressed on the subject of what happened that something bad happened, I didn’t see it.
